net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.test.widget.adapter

Class UiWidgetAdapterTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.adapter.AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<Void>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.impl.test.widget.adapter.UiWidgetAdapterTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAltText, AttributeReadAttribute, AttributeReadCollapsed, AttributeReadColumnSpan, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHeightInRows, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadLengthProperty, AttributeReadMaximumTextLength, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadSizeInPixel, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadUrl, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAltText, AttributeWriteAttribute, AttributeWriteCollapsed, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeWriteLabel, AttributeWriteLengthProperty, AttributeWriteMaximumTextLength, AttributeWriteOnlyAttribute, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteUrl, AttributeWriteValidationFailure, UiWidgetAdapter, UiWidgetAdapterActive, UiWidgetAdapterClickable, UiWidgetAdapterWithLabel, UiWidgetAdapterButton, UiWidgetAdapterCollapsableSection, UiWidgetAdapterImage, UiWidgetAdapterLabel, UiWidgetAdapterLink, UiWidgetAdapterSection, UiWidgetAdapterMenuItemClickable, UiWidgetAdapterMenuItemSeparator, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, Accessibility
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetAdapterTestComposite, UiWidgetAdapterTestField, UiWidgetAdapterTestSelectedValue

    public class UiWidgetAdapterTest
extends AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<Void>
implements AttributeWriteMaximumTextLength, AttributeWriteValidationFailure, UiWidgetAdapterButton, UiWidgetAdapterCollapsableSection, UiWidgetAdapterImage, UiWidgetAdapterLabel, UiWidgetAdapterLink, UiWidgetAdapterSection, UiWidgetAdapterMenuItemClickable, UiWidgetAdapterMenuItemSeparator, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitleVisible
    This is the implementation of UiWidgetAdapter for testing without a native toolkit.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • createToplevelWidget

        protected Void createToplevelWidget()
        This method creates the underlying widget.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is called from the constructor but implemented in sub-classes. You should NOT access or even modify member variables as they are NOT set at this point (even final members). However, this design is done by intention instead of passing the widget as constructor argument to give more flexibility by overriding and also for potential lazy initialization of the widget.
        Specified by:
        createToplevelWidget in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<Void>
        Returns:
        a new instance of the underlying widget.

      • removeFromParent

        public void removeFromParent()
        This method removes the widget from its parent. After this method, the widget is detached from the UI.
        Specified by:
        removeFromParent in interface UiWidgetAdapter

      • createAbsoluteImageUrl

        public String createAbsoluteImageUrl(String relativePath)
        This method creates an absolute URL from the given relativePath.
        Specified by:
        createAbsoluteImageUrl in interface UiWidgetAdapter
        Parameters:
        relativePath - is the relative path (URL suffix) to the image.
        Returns:
        the absolute URL.
        See Also:
        UiConfiguration.getTheme()

      • setEventSender

        public void setEventSender(UiFeatureEvent source,
                           UiHandlerEvent sender)
        This method registers the given event handler in the widget. This method will be called only once.
        Specified by:
        setEventSender in interface UiWidgetAdapter
        Parameters:
        source - is the event source.
        sender - is the UiHandlerEvent where the events are send to. This is actually an adapter that dispatches the events to the individual listeners registered in the widget.

      • getLength

        public Length getLength(LengthProperty property)
        This method gets the Length for the given LengthProperty of this object.
        E.g. the call of getLength(LengthProperty.WIDTH) will return the same result as AttributeReadSize.getWidth(). Unlike AttributeReadSize this method provides access to additional properties such as e.g. LengthProperty.MIN_WIDTH or LengthProperty.MAX_HEIGHT.
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface AttributeReadLengthProperty
        Parameters:
        property - is the LengthProperty identifying the actual property to get.
        Returns:
        the requested Length. Will be Length.ZERO if undefined (NOT set).

      • setLength

        public void setLength(LengthProperty property,
                      Length value)
        This method sets the specified length of this object.
        E.g. the call of setLength(LengthProperty.WIDTH, value) will return the same result as setWidth(value).
        Specified by:
        setLength in interface AttributeWriteLengthProperty
        Parameters:
        property - is the LengthProperty identifying the actual property to set.
        value - is the new length to set.

      • getWidthInPixel

        public double getWidthInPixel()
        This method gets the width of this object in pixels.
        NOTE:
        The result will typically be an int value. However, to be compatible with Length.getAmount() and with some underlying native toolkits we use double to prevent potential information loss.
        Specified by:
        getWidthInPixel in interface AttributeReadSizeInPixel
        Returns:
        the width.

        public double getHeightInPixel()

        NOTE:

        Specified by:
        getHeightInPixel in interface AttributeReadSizeInPixel
        Returns:
        the height.

        Parameters:

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This method disposes this object. The resources of the object are deallocated and the object can not be used or displayed anymore. If this is an object of the UI (user interface) it will be detached.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface AttributeWriteDisposed

        Parameters:

      • setFocused

        public boolean setFocused()
        This method sets the focus to this object.
        NOTE:
        You can only set the focus. To actually remove it, you need to set it in a different widget. Further, as an API user you can normally ignore the result. This is only relevant for composite widgets such as panels, that delegate the call recursively and may not contain any child that can take the focus.
        Specified by:
        setFocused in interface AttributeWriteOnlyFocused
        Returns:
        true if the focus has been set successfully, false otherwise.

      • setCollapsed

        public void setCollapsed(boolean collapsed)
        This method sets the collapsed status of this object.
        Specified by:
        setCollapsed in interface AttributeWriteCollapsed
        Parameters:
        collapsed - - if true the object will be collapsed, else it will be expanded.

      • isCollapsed

        public boolean isCollapsed()
        This method determines if this object is collapsed. This means that some content is hidden (folded away). If it is NOT collapsed, it is called expanded and the content gets visible again.
        Specified by:
        isCollapsed in interface AttributeReadCollapsed
        Returns:
        true if this object is collapsed, false if expanded.

      • getValidationFailure

        public String getValidationFailure()
        This method gets the validation failure of this object. This is a text that explains the user why the value he has entered is invalid (typically provided as tooltip of an error icon).
        Specified by:
        getValidationFailure in interface AttributeReadValidationFailure
        Overrides:
        getValidationFailure in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<Void>
        Returns:
        the validation error text or null for no error.

      • setValidationFailure

        public void setValidationFailure(String validationFailure)
        This method sets the validation failure.
        ATTENTION:
        For regular usage you should use UiFeatureValidation. This method is only intended as back-door for very special cases (e.g. you have to use your own validator infrastructure and perform validation outside this framework). It is not recommended to use this method as an API user.
        Specified by:
        setValidationFailure in interface AttributeWriteValidationFailure
        Parameters:
        validationFailure - is the validation failure text. The empty string or null will clear the error and mark the field as valid. Otherwise the field will be invalid.

      • getValidationFailureSetCount

        public int getValidationFailureSetCount()
        Returns:
        the number of invocations to setValidationFailure(String) since clearValidationFailureSetCount().

      • clearValidationFailureSetCount

        public void clearValidationFailureSetCount()
        Sets the value of getValidationFailureSetCount() to 0.

      • setMaximumTextLength

        public void setMaximumTextLength(int length)
        This method sets the maximum text length of this object.
        ATTENTION:
        If you are setting this property on a UI field, the typical behavior is that after the maximum text length is reached, any additional input is ignored. This also applies for copy and paste operations. For usability this might be undesired in many cases as users can not append something and then remove a prefix afterwards if the length would be exceeded. Please consider using a validator instead and only use this feature in situations where it is really suitable.
        Specified by:
        setMaximumTextLength in interface AttributeWriteMaximumTextLength
        Parameters:
        length - is the new maximum text length to set. Use Integer.MAX_VALUE to unset.

      • setSelectionMode

        public void setSelectionMode(SelectionMode selectionMode)
        This method sets the selection mode.
        ATTENTION:
        It is recommended to set the SelectionMode immediately after creating the object. The initial default is always SelectionMode.SINGLE_SELECTION. Dynamically changing the SelectionMode may be expensive or not be supported (in exotic implementations) and should therefore be avoided.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionMode in interface AttributeWriteSelectionMode
        Parameters:
        selectionMode - is the new SelectionMode.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(String title)
        This method sets the title of this object.
        Specified by:
        setTitle in interface AttributeWriteStringTitle
        Specified by:
        setTitle in interface AttributeWriteTitle<String>
        Parameters:
        title - is the new title.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadStringTitle.getTitle()

      • getSummary

        public String getSummary()
        This method gets the summary of this object. It describes the main purpose of this object in a short and compact way. A summary might not be visible but is honored by assistive technology such as screen-readers.
        Specified by:
        getSummary in interface AttributeReadSummary
        Returns:
        the text. Will be the empty string if no text has been set.

      • setSummary

        public void setSummary(String summary)
        This method sets the summary of this object.
        Specified by:
        setSummary in interface AttributeWriteSummary
        Parameters:
        summary - is the new summary to set.

      • isTitleVisible

        public boolean isTitleVisible()
        This method determines if the title of this object is visible. For Accessibility reasons you should always set the title of a titled object. However in specific cases you want to save space on the screen and may not require the title to be displayed for seeing users. Then you can hide the title while it is still recognized by assistive technology such as screen readers.
        Specified by:
        isTitleVisible in interface AttributeReadTitleVisible
        Returns:
        true if visible, false if hidden.

      • setTitleVisible

        public void setTitleVisible(boolean titleVisible)
        This method sets the titleVisible flag of this object.
        Specified by:
        setTitleVisible in interface AttributeWriteTitleVisible
        Parameters:
        titleVisible - is the new value for AttributeReadTitleVisible.isTitleVisible().
